name: I Am the "Runaway Bride" Quiz / Test | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which groom was I running away from when the movie began?
questions.explanation:
George Swilling.

	The movie about my life began when I was riding away from my third wedding. In each one of my weddings, I always got to the aisle, but then I chickened out. I guess I was scared to get married.

questions.text: Where does Ike Graham find me?
questions.explanation:
Hale, Maryland.

	My family and I come from Hale, Maryland. I quit engineering school to go back home so I could run the hardware business after my mother died and my father started drinking. Ike came to find me so he could confirm that everything he wrote in the article about me was completely true.

questions.text: Who did I think put the article in the paper about my failed weddings?
questions.explanation:
Peggy.

	After I found out the article wasn't a joke, I sent a letter to the editor of 'USA Today', whom I didn't realize was Ike's ex-wife. In my letter, I made a list of all fifteen factual errors that Ike had in his column about me. Ike was fired because of the errors I found.

questions.text: In my failed wedding to Gill, was the rose tattoo Ike saw on my back real?
questions.explanation:
No.

	I hated needles so I wore a stick-on rose tattoo while I was dating Gill. The tattoo was in the middle of my back and Ike made me show Gill that I really didn't have a tattoo.

questions.text: Which one of my fiancés proposed to me in St. Thomas?
questions.explanation:
George Swilling.

	I gave Ike an interview for $650.00. I told Ike about each man's proposal and showed him the rings. George put my engagement ring in a cocoon while we were at a butterfly farm in St. Thomas. I used the money from Ike to buy a wedding dress I saw in the window of a wedding boutique.

questions.text: What was the name of the hair salon that my friend Peggy owned?
questions.explanation:
Curl Up and Dye.

	The first time I saw Ike in person, I was in Peggy's hair salon. As payback for the article, Peggy and I washed his hair with several different colored dyes.

questions.text: Who told me, "You want a man who'll lead you down a beach with his hand over your eyes so you can discover the feel of the sand under your feet. You want a guy to wake you up at dawn just burning to talk to you because he can't wait another minute just to find out what you'll say. Am I right"?
questions.explanation:
Ike.

	Ike said this to me outside of the barn where they were having the luau that Mrs. Trout was hosting as an engagement party. I called Ike a creep and told him that he was trying to make me run from my fourth wedding.

questions.text: On the night of the last wedding rehearsal, what happened?
options: I got locked in the bathroom.
I had to pick up my father from the bar.
questions.explanation:
Ike kissed me.

	Two days before the wedding, Bob wanted to have one last rehearsal so I could visualize the wedding. When I got to the end of the aisle, Ike and I kissed while Bob pretended to be the minister. Bob punched Ike and left. Ike and I decided that night that we were going to keep the wedding date and get married.

questions.text: What eggs did I finally decide that I liked?
questions.explanation:
Eggs Benedict.

	One of the questions Ike asked all of my ex-fiancés was what kind of eggs I liked to eat. Each one of the men said I liked the eggs the same way that they did. I finally fixed different plates of eggs and tried each one of them. When I saw Ike again in New York after I had left him at the altar, I told him that I loved Eggs Benedict.

questions.text: In the end, who did I end up marrying?
questions.explanation:
Ike.

	Ike and I were married in Maryland with no one around because I wanted to get married on a weekday when everyone was at work. Only after we were pronounced man and wife, did everyone find out that we had gotten married.
